F1 (2025)
Friday, September 12, 2025
7:00 PM
9:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Start your engines, Mulberry! Catch F1 (2025)—the high-octane Brad Pitt racing drama from director Joseph Kosinski—on the big screen at the Gem Theater Friday, September 12. Tickets are just $5.00—perfect for a fast, fun night out.
Purchase Tickets
View Event →
Sep
19
How to Train Your Dragon (2025)
Friday, September 19, 2025
7:00 PM
9:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Start your weekend with a dragon-sized adventure! Catch How to Train Your Dragon (2025) on the big screen at Mulberry’s Gem Theater on Friday, September 19 at 7:00 p.m.—tickets just $5.00. This live-action remake from returning director Dean DeBlois stars Mason Thames (Hiccup) and Nico Parker (Astrid), with Gerard Butler back as Stoick.
Expect a family-friendly, PG-rated crowd-pleaser (approx. 125 minutes) that brings Hiccup and Toothless’s friendship to life in a new way.
Purchase Tickets
View Event →
Sep
27
Labyrinth-Dinner &  a Movie
Saturday, September 27, 2025
7:00 PM
9:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Step into a world of magic and music at the Gem Theater in Mulberry on Saturday, September 27th for our next Dinner & a Movie night featuring the beloved fantasy classic,
Labyrinth
.
Doors open at 6:30 p.m. so you can enjoy dinner and settle in, with the film beginning promptly at 7:00 p.m. Follow Sarah’s journey through the Goblin King’s maze and relive the wonder, whimsy, and unforgettable soundtrack on the big screen!
Ticket price includes admission and themed seated dinner. Any dietary restrictions must be communicated via email to cyoung@cityofmulberryfl.com on day of purchase.
Purchase Tickets
View Event →
Oct
10
The Missing Piece Theatre Presents – Our Town
Friday, October 10, 2025
7:30 PM
10:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Described as “the greatest American play ever written,” Our Town presents the small town of Grover’s Corners in three acts: “Daily Life,” “Love and Marriage” and “Death and Eternity.” The play depicts the simple daily lives of the Webb and Gibbs families as their children fall in love, marry, and eventually – in one of the most famous scenes in American theatre – well, you'll see.
“Beautiful and remarkable one of the sagest, warmest and most deeply human scripts to have come out of our theatre... A spiritual experience.” – New York Post
“No American play describes more powerfully how we imagine ourselves.” – New York Daily News
“No play ever moved me so deeply.” – Alexander Woolcott, The New Yorker
Presented through special permission from Concord Theatricals.
Purchase Tickets
View Event →

Aug

The Missing Piece Theatre Presents – Little Mermaid Jr.
Sunday, August 3, 2025
2:00 PM
3:30 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Journey "under the sea" with Ariel and her aquatic friends in Disney's The Little Mermaid JR., adapted from Disney's Broadway production and the motion picture (featuring the enormously popular Academy Award-winning music and delightfully charming book and lyrics). Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen's most beloved stories, Disney's The Little Mermaid JR. is an enchanting look at the sacrifices we all make for love and acceptance.
In a magical underwater kingdom, the beautiful young mermaid, Ariel, longs to leave her ocean home — and her fins — behind and live in the world above. But first, she'll have to defy her father, King Triton, make a deal with the evil sea witch, Ursula, and convince the handsome Prince Eric that she's the girl whose enchanting voice he's been seeking.
Purchase Tickets
The Missing Piece Theatre Company
View Event →

The Missing Piece Theatre Presents - Anything Goes! - Directed by April Golombek
Sunday, June 22, 2025
2:00 PM
4:30 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Music, dance, laughs and the age-old tale of boy meets girl…
Anything Goes
is delightful, delicious, de-lovely, and Cole Porter at his absolute best! This revised version - fresh off Broadway! - has twice as much dance music as the 1962 version and includes the hits “I Get a Kick Out of You,” “You’re the Top,” “Friendship,” “It’s De-Lovely” and the title song, along with “Easy to Love,” “Goodbye, Little Dream, Goodbye” and “Buddie, Beware.”
“
Anything Goes
exists to put a daffy grin on your face... if you’re looking for sheer escape, this is your ticket!” –
The Washington Post
“Cole Porter songs and tap-dancing sailors? What’s not to love?... The show is so packed with daffy physical shtick, comical dialogue and those still dazzlingly clever Cole Porter lyrics that it’s impossible not to surrender.” –
The Hollywood Reporter
Music and Lyrics by Cole Porter
Original Book by P.G. Wodehouse & Guy Bolton
and Howard Lindsay & Russel Crouse
New Book by Timothy Crouse & John Weidman
Presented with permission from Concord Theatricals.
Purchase Tickets
The Missing Piece Theater Company
View Event →

Our Town AUDITIONS!!!
Wednesday, June 18, 2025
7:00 PM
10:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
7:00 PM 10:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Audition Dates and Times:
- June 17th from 7pm-10pm - Gem Theater
- June 18th from 7pm-10pm - Gem Theater
- Callbacks, if needed, will be on June 19th at 7pm.
- Callbacks will be held at the Mulberry Cultural Center, 103 SE 1st Ave, Mulberry FL 33860
- To sign up for your audition slot, please fill out this form:
https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSeRak.../viewform
**Once we've received your request, we will email you a confirmation of your time slot. Auditions will be readings from the scripts and other activities - there is nothing to prepare ahead of time.
Show Dates:
- Oct. 10th, 11th and 17th at 7:30pm
- Oct. 12th, 18th and 19th at 2pm
Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact our director, Steven Bucko at stevenbucko@gmail.com.
Thank you and we look forward to seeing you at auditions!
Our Town Audition Sign Up!

ICS
Get ready for tail-wagging fun at Mulberry’s historic Gem Theater! On Saturday, May 10, 2025, at 2:00 p.m., the Gem Theater will host a special screening of Dog Man, the animated adventure based on Dav Pilkey’s beloved graphic novel series.
In this family-friendly film, a daring surgery fuses a loyal police dog with his human partner, creating Dog Man—a half-canine, half-cop hero who must thwart the mischievous plans of feline supervillain Petey the Cat. With humor, heart, and high-stakes hijinks, Dog Man is a perfect outing for kids and kids-at-heart.​
Tickets are just $2.00, offering an affordable way to enjoy a blockbuster on the big screen. The Gem Theater, located at 118 NW 1st Avenue in Mulberry, FL, provides a cozy, community-focused atmosphere ideal for moviegoers of all ages.​
Don’t miss this paws-itively delightful afternoon of fun! Outside refreshments are encouraged, especially from Mulberry's local vendors!

7:30 PM
10:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Described as “the greatest American play ever written,” Our Town presents the small town of Grover’s Corners in three acts: “Daily Life,” “Love and Marriage” and “Death and Eternity.” The play depicts the simple daily lives of the Webb and Gibbs families as their children fall in love, marry, and eventually – in one of the most famous scenes in American theatre – well, you'll see.
“Beautiful and remarkable one of the sagest, warmest and most deeply human scripts to have come out of our theatre... A spiritual experience.” – New York Post
“No American play describes more powerfully how we imagine ourselves.” – New York Daily News
“No play ever moved me so deeply.” – Alexander Woolcott, The New Yorker
Presented through special permission from Concord Theatricals.

Journey "under the sea" with Ariel and her aquatic friends in Disney's The Little Mermaid JR., adapted from Disney's Broadway production and the motion picture (featuring the enormously popular Academy Award-winning music and delightfully charming book and lyrics). Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen's most beloved stories, Disney's The Little Mermaid JR. is an enchanting look at the sacrifices we all make for love and acceptance.
In a magical underwater kingdom, the beautiful young mermaid, Ariel, longs to leave her ocean home — and her fins — behind and live in the world above. But first, she'll have to defy her father, King Triton, make a deal with the evil sea witch, Ursula, and convince the handsome Prince Eric that she's the girl whose enchanting voice he's been seeking.

The Missing Piece Theatre Presents - Anything Goes! - Directed by April Golombek
Sunday, June 22, 2025
2:00 PM
4:30 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Music, dance, laughs and the age-old tale of boy meets girl…
Anything Goes
is delightful, delicious, de-lovely, and Cole Porter at his absolute best! This revised version - fresh off Broadway! - has twice as much dance music as the 1962 version and includes the hits “I Get a Kick Out of You,” “You’re the Top,” “Friendship,” “It’s De-Lovely” and the title song, along with “Easy to Love,” “Goodbye, Little Dream, Goodbye” and “Buddie, Beware.”
“
Anything Goes
exists to put a daffy grin on your face... if you’re looking for sheer escape, this is your ticket!” –
The Washington Post
“Cole Porter songs and tap-dancing sailors? What’s not to love?... The show is so packed with daffy physical shtick, comical dialogue and those still dazzlingly clever Cole Porter lyrics that it’s impossible not to surrender.” –
The Hollywood Reporter
Music and Lyrics by Cole Porter
Original Book by P.G. Wodehouse & Guy Bolton
and Howard Lindsay & Russel Crouse
New Book by Timothy Crouse & John Weidman
Presented with permission from Concord Theatricals.
Purchase Tickets

The Missing Piece Theatre Presents - Anything Goes! - Directed by April Golombek
Sunday, June 15, 2025
2:00 PM
4:30 PM
The GEM Theater
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Music, dance, laughs and the age-old tale of boy meets girl…
Anything Goes
is delightful, delicious, de-lovely, and Cole Porter at his absolute best! This revised version - fresh off Broadway! - has twice as much dance music as the 1962 version and includes the hits “I Get a Kick Out of You,” “You’re the Top,” “Friendship,” “It’s De-Lovely” and the title song, along with “Easy to Love,” “Goodbye, Little Dream, Goodbye” and “Buddie, Beware.”
“
Anything Goes
exists to put a daffy grin on your face... if you’re looking for sheer escape, this is your ticket!” –
The Washington Post
“Cole Porter songs and tap-dancing sailors? What’s not to love?... The show is so packed with daffy physical shtick, comical dialogue and those still dazzlingly clever Cole Porter lyrics that it’s impossible not to surrender.” –
The Hollywood Reporter
Music and Lyrics by Cole Porter
Original Book by P.G. Wodehouse & Guy Bolton
and Howard Lindsay & Russel Crouse
New Book by Timothy Crouse & John Weidman
Presented with permission from Concord Theatricals.

2:00 PM
4:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Get ready for tail-wagging fun at Mulberry’s historic Gem Theater! On Saturday, May 10, 2025, at 2:00 p.m., the Gem Theater will host a special screening of Dog Man, the animated adventure based on Dav Pilkey’s beloved graphic novel series.
In this family-friendly film, a daring surgery fuses a loyal police dog with his human partner, creating Dog Man—a half-canine, half-cop hero who must thwart the mischievous plans of feline supervillain Petey the Cat. With humor, heart, and high-stakes hijinks, Dog Man is a perfect outing for kids and kids-at-heart.​
Tickets are just $2.00, offering an affordable way to enjoy a blockbuster on the big screen. The Gem Theater, located at 118 NW 1st Avenue in Mulberry, FL, provides a cozy, community-focused atmosphere ideal for moviegoers of all ages.​
Don’t miss this paws-itively delightful afternoon of fun! Outside refreshments are encouraged, especially from Mulberry's local vendors!

The Missing Piece Theatre Presents – Our Town
Friday, October 10, 2025
7:30 PM
10:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Described as “the greatest American play ever written,” Our Town presents the small town of Grover’s Corners in three acts: “Daily Life,” “Love and Marriage” and “Death and Eternity.” The play depicts the simple daily lives of the Webb and Gibbs families as their children fall in love, marry, and eventually – in one of the most famous scenes in American theatre – well, you'll see.
“Beautiful and remarkable one of the sagest, warmest and most deeply human scripts to have come out of our theatre... A spiritual experience.” – New York Post
“No American play describes more powerfully how we imagine ourselves.” – New York Daily News
“No play ever moved me so deeply.” – Alexander Woolcott, The New Yorker
Presented through special permission from Concord Theatricals.

Sunday, August 3, 2025

3:30 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Journey "under the sea" with Ariel and her aquatic friends in Disney's The Little Mermaid JR., adapted from Disney's Broadway production and the motion picture (featuring the enormously popular Academy Award-winning music and delightfully charming book and lyrics). Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen's most beloved stories, Disney's The Little Mermaid JR. is an enchanting look at the sacrifices we all make for love and acceptance.
In a magical underwater kingdom, the beautiful young mermaid, Ariel, longs to leave her ocean home — and her fins — behind and live in the world above. But first, she'll have to defy her father, King Triton, make a deal with the evil sea witch, Ursula, and convince the handsome Prince Eric that she's the girl whose enchanting voice he's been seeking.

Get ready for tail-wagging fun at Mulberry’s historic Gem Theater! On Saturday, May 10, 2025, at 2:00 p.m., the Gem Theater will host a special screening of Dog Man, the animated adventure based on Dav Pilkey’s beloved graphic novel series.
In this family-friendly film, a daring surgery fuses a loyal police dog with his human partner, creating Dog Man—a half-canine, half-cop hero who must thwart the mischievous plans of feline supervillain Petey the Cat. With humor, heart, and high-stakes hijinks, Dog Man is a perfect outing for kids and kids-at-heart.​
Tickets are just $2.00, offering an affordable way to enjoy a blockbuster on the big screen. The Gem Theater, located at 118 NW 1st Avenue in Mulberry, FL, provides a cozy, community-focused atmosphere ideal for moviegoers of all ages.​
Don’t miss this paws-itively delightful afternoon of fun! Outside refreshments are encouraged, especially from Mulberry's local vendors!

7:30 PM
10:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Described as “the greatest American play ever written,” Our Town presents the small town of Grover’s Corners in three acts: “Daily Life,” “Love and Marriage” and “Death and Eternity.” The play depicts the simple daily lives of the Webb and Gibbs families as their children fall in love, marry, and eventually – in one of the most famous scenes in American theatre – well, you'll see.
“Beautiful and remarkable one of the sagest, warmest and most deeply human scripts to have come out of our theatre... A spiritual experience.” – New York Post
“No American play describes more powerfully how we imagine ourselves.” – New York Daily News
“No play ever moved me so deeply.” – Alexander Woolcott, The New Yorker
Presented through special permission from Concord Theatricals.

Journey "under the sea" with Ariel and her aquatic friends in Disney's The Little Mermaid JR., adapted from Disney's Broadway production and the motion picture (featuring the enormously popular Academy Award-winning music and delightfully charming book and lyrics). Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen's most beloved stories, Disney's The Little Mermaid JR. is an enchanting look at the sacrifices we all make for love and acceptance.
In a magical underwater kingdom, the beautiful young mermaid, Ariel, longs to leave her ocean home — and her fins — behind and live in the world above. But first, she'll have to defy her father, King Triton, make a deal with the evil sea witch, Ursula, and convince the handsome Prince Eric that she's the girl whose enchanting voice he's been seeking.

The Missing Piece Theatre Presents - Anything Goes! - Directed by April Golombek
Sunday, June 22, 2025
2:00 PM
4:30 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Music, dance, laughs and the age-old tale of boy meets girl…
Anything Goes
is delightful, delicious, de-lovely, and Cole Porter at his absolute best! This revised version - fresh off Broadway! - has twice as much dance music as the 1962 version and includes the hits “I Get a Kick Out of You,” “You’re the Top,” “Friendship,” “It’s De-Lovely” and the title song, along with “Easy to Love,” “Goodbye, Little Dream, Goodbye” and “Buddie, Beware.”
“
Anything Goes
exists to put a daffy grin on your face... if you’re looking for sheer escape, this is your ticket!” –
The Washington Post
“Cole Porter songs and tap-dancing sailors? What’s not to love?... The show is so packed with daffy physical shtick, comical dialogue and those still dazzlingly clever Cole Porter lyrics that it’s impossible not to surrender.” –
The Hollywood Reporter
Music and Lyrics by Cole Porter
Original Book by P.G. Wodehouse & Guy Bolton
and Howard Lindsay & Russel Crouse
New Book by Timothy Crouse & John Weidman
Presented with permission from Concord Theatricals.

2:00 PM
4:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Get ready for tail-wagging fun at Mulberry’s historic Gem Theater! On Saturday, May 10, 2025, at 2:00 p.m., the Gem Theater will host a special screening of Dog Man, the animated adventure based on Dav Pilkey’s beloved graphic novel series.
In this family-friendly film, a daring surgery fuses a loyal police dog with his human partner, creating Dog Man—a half-canine, half-cop hero who must thwart the mischievous plans of feline supervillain Petey the Cat. With humor, heart, and high-stakes hijinks, Dog Man is a perfect outing for kids and kids-at-heart.​
Tickets are just $2.00, offering an affordable way to enjoy a blockbuster on the big screen. The Gem Theater, located at 118 NW 1st Avenue in Mulberry, FL, provides a cozy, community-focused atmosphere ideal for moviegoers of all ages.​
Don’t miss this paws-itively delightful afternoon of fun! Outside refreshments are encouraged, especially from Mulberry's local vendors!

The Gem Theater is a department of the City of Mulberry funded through the City’s Community Redevelopment Agency.
Mission Statement
The mission of the Gem Theater is to enrich, educate, and entertain the community of Mulberry and its guests through quality cultural and artistic events and productions.
Objectives:
I.        To create an ongoing schedule of film and performing arts programs available to the public that entertain a diverse audience
II.      To be valued as a culturally significant asset locally and regionally
III.   To serve as a catalyst for growth in the downtown Mulberry area and its surrounding communities
The Gem Theater was originally built by the Arnold Family and delighted audiences in its current location from 1947 - 1957.
